dialogues.text: She went to Medical school in  California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, brother. (beat) I don't know what to tell ya. You  know all the girls I been with. You  been with 'em too, except for Cheryl  McGovern which was a big mistake on  your part brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'm sure, that's why only one of  us has herpes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some shows are worth the price of  admission, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets a small laugh from Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fuckin' back is killin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A passing SHEET METAL WORKER overhears this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why you should'a gone to  college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck my crank. Fuckin' sheet metal  pussy. (beat) So, when are you done with those  meetin's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Week after I'm twenty-one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are they hookin' you up with a job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sit in a room and do long  division for the next fifty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah, but it's better than this shit.  At least you'd make some nice bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, be a fuckin' lab rat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a way outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I want a way outta here for?   I want to live here the rest of my  life. I want to be your next door  neighbor. I want to take out kids to  little league together up Foley Field.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're my best friend, so don't  take this the wrong way, but in 20  years, if you're livin' next door to  me, comin' over watchin' the fuckin' Patriots' games and still workin'  construction, I'll fuckin' kill you.  And that's not a threat, that's a  fact. I'll fuckin' kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie, what are you talkin'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, you got somethin' that none  of us have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is it always this? I owe it to  myself? What if I don't want to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. You owe it to me. Tomorrow  I'm gonna wake up and I'll be fifty  and I'll still be doin' this. And  that's all right 'cause I'm gonna  make a run at it.  But you, you're  sittin' on a winning lottery ticket  and you're too much of a pussy to  cash it in. And that's bullshit 'cause  I'd do anything to have what you  got! And so would any of these guys.   It'd be a fuckin' insult to us if  you're still here in twenty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you what I do know. Every  day I come by to pick you up, and we  go out drinkin' or whatever and we  have a few laughs. But you know what  the best part of my day is? The ten  seconds before I knock on the door  'cause I let myself think I might  get there, and you'd be gone. I'd  knock on the door and you wouldn't  be there. You just left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, I don't know much. But I know  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lambeau stands across from Sean, seething.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a disaster! I brought you in  here to help me with this boy, not  to run him out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait a minute--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --And confuse him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Gerry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here I am for the second week in  a row with my professional reputation  at stake--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to falsify documents because  you've given him license to walk  away from this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing and I know why  I'm here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Sean, I don't care if you have  a rapport with the boy -- I don't  care if you have a few laughs --  even at my expense! But don't you  dare undermine what I'm trying to do  here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Undermine?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a gift and with that gift  comes responsibility. And you don't  understand that he's at a fragile  point--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is at a fragile point. He's got  problems--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What problems does he have, Sean,  that he is better off as a janitor  or in jail or hanging around with--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you think he does that, Gerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can handle the work, he can handle  the pressure and he's obviously  handled you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is he hiding? Why is he a janitor? Why doesn't he trust anybody? Because  the first thing that happened to him  was that he was abandoned by the  people who were supposed to love him  the most!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, Sean--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why does he hang out with his  friends? Because any one of those  kids would come in here and take a  bat to your head if he asked them  to. It's called loyalty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's nice--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who do you think he's handling?   He pushes people away before they  have a chance to leave him. And for  20 years he's been alone because of  that. And if you try to push him  into this, it's going to be the same  thing all over again. And I'm not  going to let that happen to him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now don't do that. Don't you do that! Don't infect him with the idea that  it's okay to quit. That it's okay to  be a failure, because it's not okay!  If you're angry at me for being  successful, for being what you could  have been--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I'm not angry at you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are, Sean. You resent me.  And I'm not going to apologize for  any success that I've had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I don't have any anger at you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you do. You're angry at me for  doing what you could have done. Ask  yourself if you want Will to feel  that way for the rest of his life,  to feel like a failure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. That's why I don't come  to the goddamn reunions!  Because I  can't stand the look in your eye  when you see me! You think I'm a  failure! I know who I am. I'm proud  of who I am. And all of you, you  think I'm some kind of pity case!  You with your sycophant students  following you around. And your Goddamn  Medal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what this is about, Sean?  The Field's Medal? Do you want me to  go home and get it for you? Then  will you let the boy--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your trophy and I don't  give a shit about it! 'Cause I knew  you when!! You and Jack and Tom  Sanders. I knew you when you were  homesick and pimply-faced and didn't  know what side of the bed to piss  on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right!  You were smarter than  us then and you're smarter than us  now! So don't blame me for how your  life turned out. It's not my fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't blame you! It's not about  that!  It's about the boy! 'Cause  he's a good kid! And I won't see  this happen to him- won't see you  make him feel like a failure too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't be a failure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you push him into something, if  you ride him--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong, Sean. I'm where I am  today because I was pushed. And  because I learned to push myself!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat. Lambeau turns, something catches his eye. Sean tu to look, IT'S WILL. He is standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's fine, Will. I was just  leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is an awkward moment as Lambeau gets his coat and  leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm here. (beat) So, is that my problem? I'm afraid  of being abandoned? That was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, a lot of that stuff goes back  a long way. And it's between me and  him and it has nothing to do with  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to talk about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean smiles. A beat. Will sees a FILE on Sean's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is your file. I have to  send it back to the Judge with my  evaluation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to fail me are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's it say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to read it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. (beat) Have you had any experience with  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty years of counseling you see a  lot of--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, have you had any experience with  that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) It sure ain't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From a child's P.O.V. we see a man, partially obscured by doorframe. The man turns toward the P.O.V.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a pause) My dad used to make us walk down to  the park and collect the sticks he  was going to beat us with. Actually  the worst of the beatings were between  me and my brother. We would practice  on each other trying to find sticks  that would break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to just put a belt, a stick  and a wrench on the kitchen table  and say "choose."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, callused hand sets down a wrench next to a stick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta go with the belt there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to go with the wrench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wrench, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cause fuck him, that's why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long quiet moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why me and Skylar broke up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know you had. Do you want  to talk about that? (beat) I don't know a lot, Will. But let me  tell you one thing. All this history,  this shit... (indicates file) Look here, son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will, who had been looking away, loos at Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nonchalant) Oh, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dead serious) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (comes around desk,  sits in front of  Will) It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tears start) I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying hard) I know, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean takes Will in his arms and holds him like a child. W sobs like a baby. After a moment, he wraps his arms aroun Sean and holds him, even tighter. We pull back from this  image. Two lonely souls being father and son together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will rides the Red Line, above ground. He looks out over landscape. Small back yards, laundry hangs from wire line Chainlink fences, overgrown with weeds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walking through South Boston. He cuts through a park senior citizen is spearing trach for the city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will at home. Not reading. Looks up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks up to a nondescript building, he walks through the glass doors, into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will walks into the lobby. A SECURITY GUARD looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, my name is Will Hunting. I'm  here about a position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FADE UP to the sound of laughter. INT. L STREET BAR & GRILLE -- DAY Chuckie is again regaling Will and the guys at their tabl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I got the most fucked up  thing I been meanin' to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it for your mother, funny guy.  We heard it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both get up, in one another's face. This is a play f "You gonna start?" "You gonna pay my hospital bills?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to miss this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will comes back from the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chuckie) You and Morgan throw?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I had to talk him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you yoke him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Morgan's got a lot a scrap,  dude.  I'd rather fight a big kid,  they never fight, everyone's scared  of 'em. You know how many people try  to whip Morgan's ass every week?  Fuckin' kid won't back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from across the table) What'd you say about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy walks in the door and give Chuckie a look. Chuckie  turns to Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Will) Hey, asshole. Happy Birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought we forgot, didn't you? I  know I'm gettin' my licks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter as the boys converge on Will. He goes willingly the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they come out the door, rather than beating Will  mercilessly, they stop. Morgan goes into his own, persona rendition of "Danny Boy." No one joins in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Morgan. (to Will) Here's your present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie indicates an old CHEVY NOVA, parked illegally in  front of the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kiddin' me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured now that you got  your big job over in Cambridge, you  needed some way to get over there  and I knew I wasn't gonna drive you  every day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan wanted to get you a "T" pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will approaches the car to take a closer look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're twenty-one now, so--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, now that you can drink legally,  we thought the best thing to get you  was a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More laughter. Will inspects the Nova.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kiddin' me. (a beat) This is the ugliest fuckin' car I  ever seen in my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughter, a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious) How the fuck did you guys do this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and Bill scraped together the  parts, worked on it. Morgan was out  panhandlin' every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, I did the body work. Whose  fuckin' router you think sanded out  all that bondo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy's been up my ass for two years  about a fuckin' job. I had to let  him help with the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you finally got a job Morgan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had one, now I'm fucked again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Chuckie) So what do you got, a fuckin' Hyundai  engine under there? Can I make it  back to my house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I re-built the engine  myself.  That thing could make it to  Hawaii if you wanted it to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie gives Will a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy 21, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits across from Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one did you take, Will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over at Tri-tech. One of the jobs  Professor Lambeau set me up with. I  haven't told him yet, but I talked  to my new boss over there and he  seemed like a nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks you. (a beat) So, that's it? We're done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're done. You did your time. You're  a free man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know, Sean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Welcome, Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll keep in touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna travel a little bit, so I  don't know where I'll be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... figured it's time I put my  money back on the table, see what  kind of cards I get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will smiles. Sean hands him a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be checking in with my machine  at the college. If you ever need  anything, just call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what's in your heart, son. You'll  be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks you, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They embrace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: embrace) Does this violate the patient/doctor  relationship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if you grab my ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will comes out of Sean's office and sees Lambeau walking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, you're no longer required  to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just sayin' goodbye to Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Sam called me. From Tri-tech. He  says you start working for them next  week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's, I think that's terrific. Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know... It's been  a pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This job... Do it if it's what you  really want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment. Will starts to go, Lambeau watches him for a be Will turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Gerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'll be nearby so, if you  need some help, or you get stuck  again, don't be afraid to give me a  call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (has to smile) Thank you, Will. I'll do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will smiles, turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean is packing his office. Lambeau opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Sean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat) Me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I hear you're taking some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Summer vacation. Thought I'd  travel some. Maybe write a little  bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where're you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. India maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lambeau nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know when you'll be back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up a flyer  from his desk) I got this mailer the other day.  Class of Sixty-five is having this  event in six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got one of those too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should come. I'll buy you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lambeau smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drinks at those things are free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about one now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on you though, until eight  o'clock tonight when I win my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean pulls out his lottery ticket. They start out down th hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On their backs as they walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean, do you have any idea what the  odds are against winning the lottery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... Gotta be at least  four to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About thirty million to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're pretty quick with those  numbers.  How about the odds of me  buying the first round?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About thirty million to one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will sits alone, thinking. We hold on him for an extended beat until he gets up and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin final sequence. A wide, establishing shot of Sean's apartment complex as sun is setting. The lights are on in one unit. A tighter  shot reveals Sean, in his apartment, packing his belongin in cardboard boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera cranes down from Sean's window and onto the st where we pan to reveal Will, sitting in his car and looki up at Sean as he packs his things. Will's car is packed f of clothes and books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie and the boys drive down the street in the Cadilla Morgan and Billy ride in the back, leaving the shotgun se open for Will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will holds an envelope which he slips in Sean's mailbox. puts the flag up and smiles as he looks up at Sean in his apartment who is still unaware that Will is there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie pulls up in front of Will's house. He honks the h waits a beat, then gets out and heads toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will drives away from Sean's house. Sean hears the car pu out and looks out the window. Sean sees Will's car pullin away. Curious, he investigates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie walks up Will's front steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean walks out to the sidewalk and looks around. Seeing t mailbox flag has been raised, he walks over to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie knocks on Will's front door. There is no answer. waits a beat, looks in the window. An incredulous smile s starts to form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sean opens the card Will left for him. It reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in writing) Sean -- If the Professor calls about  that job, just tell him, "Sorry, I  had to go see about a girl."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuckie walks back towards his car unable to contain the  broad smile. He knows Will is gone. He shrugs in explanat to the guys. Morgan takes Will's seat as they pull away f the curb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan up from the letter to Sean. A broad smile comes ov him. This is a look we haven't seen. Sean is truly happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will is on the road, driving away. As we pull back and cr roll, the car disappears into the horizon.
